chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Allen Majorowicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Allen Majorowicz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Allen Majorowicz was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued. (Call Department of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: $1,219 fine/costs to COCC.  60 days to pay or set payment plan.  Failure to pay is a warrant.  Bond to be applied.
Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.

timeConds.notes:
Subject to work release after 48 hours has been served.
Subject to good time.
